page.title: 19CHURCH BUILDINGS
page.content: Corhampton Church is a small, mostly saxon church built about 1020 notable for its C12th. murals, its saxon sundial and a yew tree in the churchyard thought to be as old as the church,having a girth of 26 feet. The church is undedicated. St.Andrews Church, Meonstoke is C13th. built on the site of an earlier church which was mentioned in the Domesday Book. St.Peter's and St.Paul's,Exton is also C13th. built on the site of a C9th. church. It was largely rebuilt in 1847. Our Lady of Warnford church was built in about 1190 on the site of a church believed to have been built by St. Wilfred and used as his headquarters.
